title: ASL 8.1 ‚Äî School & Work Routines (Schedules ‚Ä¢ Tasks ‚Ä¢ Requests) üóìÔ∏è
objectives: Talk about daily/weekly schedules using time-first framing
Request, accept, and decline help politely using RS with neutral returns
Report tasks with FINISH/DUE and confirm next actions briefly

vocab.def: Days of week; use as anchors for schedule.
Marks completed item/leg; brief head nod.
Polite ask; add small forward lean.
Supervisor/teacher ‚Üî employee/student lines with neutral returns.

sections.heading: Model: Time-First Schedule Lines

media.alt: Signer listing schedule items with pauses
media.caption: TIME ‚Üí ACTIVITY ‚Üí brief pause

sections.body:
Examples (3‚Äì5 signs each):
‚Ä¢ **MONDAY MORNING CLASS. AFTERNOON WORK.**
‚Ä¢ **TUESDAY NIGHT MEETING.**
‚Ä¢ **WEDNESDAY HOMEWORK DUE.**
Add **FINISH** after a completed item: **EMAIL SEND FINISH.**

sections.heading: Requests & Replies (RS)
sections.body:
RS‚ÜíRequester: **PLEASE HELP PROJECT?** (eyebrows neutral/kind)  
Neutral.  
RS‚ÜíResponder: **CAN TODAY AFTERNOON.** / **SORRY CAN'T, MEETING.**  
Use **MUST/SHOULD** for obligations/suggestions: **MUST EMAIL TODAY. SHOULD START EARLY.**

callouts.title: Polite Package
callouts.body: Add PLEASE + small forward lean + nod when asking. Return to neutral between lines.

sections.heading: Partner Drill: Task + Deadline + Ask
sections.body:
A states schedule with one **DUE** item, then asks for help. B accepts or declines and proposes a time. A repeat-backs key detail.  
Example:
‚Ä¢ **THURSDAY PROJECT DUE. PLEASE HELP WEDNESDAY NIGHT?**  
‚Ä¢ **B:** **CAN WEDNESDAY NIGHT.**  
‚Ä¢ **A (repeat-back):** **OK WEDNESDAY NIGHT HELP.**

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **18‚Äì25s**: list **3 schedule items** (days/time-first), include **1 request** and **1 response**, and mark **FINISH** on one completed task. Include one short **repeat-back**.
sections.teacherNote: Caption which day/time anchors you used and which task was FINISHed.
